instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage not turning on. Replaced <RESISTOR>R5167</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5181</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R5002</RESISTOR> <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> <RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR> <CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR> <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> <RESISTOR>R1961</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R1960</RESISTOR>. Afterwards had fan spin and booted into OSX no problem.

After ultrasonic with crest there is no fan spin and all rails including <SIGNAL>PPVCC_SO_CPU</SIGNAL> only  pulse for a second. Havens run into this issue before.

All termination resistors measure good and have good continuity.

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
Something happened in the ultrasonic process.
Maybe knocked off component, or broken trace...

Do you get pulse at pin 7/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
Check all the traces between replaced components.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Also try the board disconnecting LIO flex, airport card and SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
Traces from replaced components have been checked multiple times and are good.

No luck on SMC bypass or disconnecting LIO flex. Airport card and SSD also removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
Noticed a pattern on this board. If <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is removed board powers up with fan spin but only draws 140-150 miliamps however once <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is soldered back to the board i gos through the same symptoms of no fan spin and powers rails pulsing. Tried multimple <CHIP>U1950S</CHIP> with same sympoms

Any ideas? Traces tested and good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
threads.message: Can a ultrasonic cleaner ruin the board internally if it is left in it for too long? I know this board was left in more then 10 minutes today after the process was completed by mistake. Cant find any bad traces and continuity is good on everything that was replaced. Checked multiple times. With everything on the board it draws 26-50 milimps for a few seconds, goes to 0 then continues. At moments it might go up to 170 miliamps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
threads.message:
The board cannot work without <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>; PCH needs <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>.
Try removing <CHIP>U8130</CHIP>.

UC can damage the board, especially if no sweep option is used.
Hot spots can break traces, or knock off components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not working after ultrasonic.
